intro: Cicer sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis vetch, is a rare leguminous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces lens-shaped pods that contain several seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by wind. Cicer sintenisii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
